Paris is considered as city of love; indeed on my visit to Paris, I fall in love with this city. Whiling walking randomly on the streets during the Olympics 2024 I happened to discover this magnificent church.  Itâ€™s a must visit place if you are visiting in Paris. I really donâ€™t have much words to describe such art works. If you are passionate about architectural designs, this is a must to go place for you.

During our visit to Paris for the Olympics, we took the opportunity to explore La Madeleine, and it quickly became one of the highlights of our trip. The first impression of this historic church is truly breathtaking. The grandeur of the neoclassical architecture, with its imposing columns and intricate details, commands attention from the moment you approach. As we stepped inside, we were immediately struck by the sheer beauty and serenity of the interior. The church is filled with stunning artworks, statues, and a sense of timelessness that creates a profound atmosphere.  For those who are Catholic or simply have an appreciation for religious artifacts, La Madeleine offers a charming gift shop inside. Here, you can purchase rosaries and other meaningful keepsakes, allowing you to take a piece of the experience home. Itâ€™s a thoughtful addition that adds to the overall visit, especially for those who find personal significance in these items.  If youâ€™re planning a visit to La Madeleine, here are a few traveler tips to enhance your experience. First, consider visiting early in the morning or later in the afternoon to avoid the peak crowds. This will give you a chance to take in the beauty of the church in a more peaceful setting. While photography is allowed, itâ€™s important to be respectful of the sacred space, especially if there are people praying or a service in progress.  Additionally, La Madeleine is situated near some fantastic Parisian landmarks, so consider combining your visit with a stroll down Rue Royale or a stop at Place de la Concorde. Lastly, as with many religious sites, modest attire is appreciated, so itâ€™s wise to have a scarf or shawl handy just in case.
A massive and magnificent building in the heart of Paris. Its large dimensions are truly hard to explain. Totally unmissable. The interior is very pretty too.

A beautiful church with the relics of St Mary Magdeleine is a real Wonder. The huge pillars and grand door welcome the visitors to one of the well designed churches of Paris. I really liked the altar with the beautiful paintings and well carved statues.

This was my first visit to the madeleine and i was in awe of the architecture in this place both exterior and interior. There are so many details and you can visit it for free and no tickets are needed to enter. A definite must stop on your tour of paris.
Incredible building and wonderful inside. I am not religious myself but the beauty and craftsmanship is something to behold. No entrance fee.

La Madeleine is an impressive and elegant church in Paris, known for its grand neoclassical design resembling a Greek temple. Its towering columns and stunning interior make it a must-see for architecture and history lovers. Inside, you'll find beautiful artwork and a peaceful atmosphere perfect for reflection. Located near the bustling Boulevard Haussmann, it's easy to combine a visit with nearby shopping and dining. A beautiful and unique landmark that adds to the charm of Paris!

Nice church, with the beautiful experience of making it right on time  to enjoy a group of young girls singing "chants for peace".
Love the history of this church, that was once a temple for Napoleon. Beautiful inside and out. Canâ€™t believe how tall it actually is.

La Madeleine Church, located in Paris, is a stunning example of neoclassical architecture, resembling a grand Greek temple with its impressive columns and intricate bronze doors. Inside, the church is beautifully decorated with marble and gold, providing a serene and elegant atmosphere. It is well-known for its exceptional organ concerts and classical music performances, thanks to its excellent acoustics. Situated near popular Paris landmarks, La Madeleine is easily accessible and surrounded by shopping and dining options. Itâ€™s a beautiful and unique church to visit for its architecture, history, and music.
Another amazing place to visit when visitnig Paris, the scale of this place is amazing, you will be amazed by it's beauty and size. All in all a very beatyfull place to visit.
The church is an architectural wonder, you canâ€™t but feel humbled by the statues and paintings of Jesus and the saints. Itâ€™s a must visit if you are in the church

Church dedicated to Saint Mary of Magdala. Its troubled construction history is reflected in its architecture: the church has been redesigned many times before it was finally ultimated. Remarkable the main fresco "The History of Christianity", in which all the main historical figures of French History pay their homages to the Lord.
A very beautiful church, close to place de la Concorde.
Wow this is an amazing Christian church in the style of a Roman Parthenon structure. It is beautiful outside and inside. A must see when in Paris.
Came for a Holy Games symphony concert where the Symphony Academy of Paris performed Vivaldi, Bach, Pachelbel, and Mozart. Very picturesque and grand Neo-classical church.
Such a majestic beauty !!!! You can spend a lot of time just appreciating all the beautiful corners, ceiling, sculptures.
Iconic church in the middle of Paris, filled with history and great views of Bastille. Great place for worshippers and tourists.
Why bother going inside when you can admire this beauty from the outside? Plus, it's like the Paris Pantheon's twin!

They've not completely finished the exterior cleaning but the side that's been done is magic. Inside, youâ€™ll find beautiful sculptures, detailed frescoes, and a famous pipe organ used in concerts. FrÃ©dÃ©ric Chopin's funeral was there and they did the Mozart Requiem. Last night I listened to Verdi's Requiem and it was stunning as always.  ParisDiscovered Tip: Head to Foyer de la Madeleine in the basement for a budget-friendly French meal. Itâ€™s a hidden gem worth visiting, but check their hours as access may vary.
I was lucky to witness the sunday church service. This is indeed a very beautiful church.

This is one of the more majestic churches you can visit. From the outside it looks like a Greek acropolis with Corinthian columns, inside there are beautiful arches and open domes credit to pantheon. Dressed with beautiful ionic columns and fine marble statues. This is an extraordinary church and concert venue. The reverberation sound here is amazing.
Hidden gem! Free entry. Must visit when in Paris
Biggest and best church I have ever seen. No admission fee, just walk in. Missed free classical music concert Hayden, Mozart requiem.

It is now being renovated, like many other buildings at that time. However, it was still open and the interior has many beautiful statues and details. It is very reminiscent of the Acropolis of Athens. When you walk up the stairs, you are surprised by these huge columns. Admission is free. Or you can blow a candle and whistle.
Beautiful Cathedral.  Recently cleaned on the outside.  Wonderful organ on the inside

Majestic church which really deserves a visit while in Paris. It has an interesting architecture, both at exterior and interior, resembling a temple. You won't see any other church like this in Paris. Free entrance, but it is worth making a small donation and light up a candle.
Beautiful church built in a Greek style architecture It contains the relics of Marie Magdalene
Beautiful church, huge interior area...

Absolutely spectacular church!!! The interior work is amazing and would get 5 stars. But I donâ€™t recommend it for concerts unless you are right up front. The echo is so persistent that music sounds like muffled noise. As a concert venue I would give it a 3/5.
Classical Catholic temple with Corinthian columns on all four sides, built in the 1800s. Free admission.
Amazing and huge building in greek style. Recommend. It's worth to see.
